posts.body:
>8chan captcha broken again
>Goes down completely on the clearnet
>Comes back up on TOR
>Again no captcha
>That's finally enough, time for zeronet
>Try to get it to work on gentoo
>TOR browser changed the name of the no_proxies_on variable and removed the normalfag gui option as well
>Zeronet daemon fucks sockets like whores, port not available on restart
>TOR eternally fucked
>All the tips from the internet do no good
>Neurotic permissions
>Near insanity
>Boot into windows
>Ok works here, fuck you whoever said router config
>Damn I need to get a cert too?
Goddamnit, can I post now? What about the cert? Let's just see if my username is displayed on here. I guess I can always get rid of it and get a new one? Next try

>>dbc07b4b-0971-40cc-85d8-b1c7730627cf
>>77adbbf3-c67c-4571-b101-61123729bc06
The chen2 admin just did that to piss off the people using their /pol/. Pissing off people with switch and bait is his favorite hobby. I doubt he'd be worried about journos or anything. But yeah, chen/pol/ was really fun for a while. Nothing to be taken too seriously but a funny shitposting fest, like /pol/ getting drunk together. Now the site is dead and half of the people left even using it are just flooding the catalog of every board because they're pissed with the removal of /pol/.  Good riddance I say!
If it wasn't closed down I probably wouldn't have bothered with zeronet.

>>6cf95153-9aa0-4c5e-987f-8b395a0cd58d
I agree. Ultimately, everyone is responsible for himself. If someone wants to destroy himself, let him, but don't make the cost of it a burden to the rest of society.

>>a1829b0f-fb0d-46fd-a5b1-681ade071372
And the sad thing is, Germany is slowly but surely returning to that socialist system and becoming GDR 2.0 just as we speak.

>>b76fc804-0fd9-4cd6-9233-9574995c70a3
And he doesn't even really care about any of the political issues attached with it, he just uses them as a leverage for his personal crusade against Jim Watkins. HW is literally just a pissed off, estrogen filled script kiddie attention whore, just like the people he surrounds himself with such as nanotech and l33tguy.

>>7536837e-2540-4780-9c6c-abf202c9435f
Qwant, Searx, Startpage. And Bing at least seems to have a better index than google.

>>2dc648d9-990a-4fa7-8460-f88281b30808
Will 8chan ever come back? 
I think so, yes, it's getting better and better but they are still testing stuff, and the site breaks every few hours or so because they are still fiddling around. Also the boards aren't migrated yet, it's more of a betatest.
jthnx5wyvjvzsxtu.onion works most reliably
>Where did all the anons go?
http://nanochanqwrwtmamtnhkfwbbcducc4i62ciss4byo6f3an5qdkhjngid.onion/
http://beepedjhffvat3uwij5fxny72vlj7ugqb67ippjebise6adxf73y3uqd.onion/
vch.moe
smuglo.li
chen2.org
endchan.org
julay.world
some just went back to cuckchan/reddit/twitter
All in all I am very glad there is 0net too.

>>142d5f87-51af-43c5-9051-5557af73e683
No Linus, no RMS, what a boring future. It's almost as if everybody that has a little character is leaving. At this point the "open source community" will be little more than just foundations co-opted by big tech companies and leftists.

>>120f5fe4-1a7f-4033-9f4d-5cc053fca702
Zero is always there in case you need it. Most people probably see it as a backup and I can't blame them. Let's just all keep seeding.

>>947c029f-1058-4924-96e8-f00eb159ac50
The Julay admin just isn't getting along very well with MongoDB, those aren't attacks.

>>b6a8eec7-a573-4f3c-83da-b5939a9f1c04
60 Trackers? That's pretty cool indeed.

>>2eb9c66c-2e4b-4868-9e9b-4b2f8eb4793b
>I think many anons will return to 8kun when /pol/ and other boards are back. 
Yes, someone made a board called /pnd/ that acts as a /pol/ bunker and it has gotten a lot of activity almost instantly. In general, it feels like 8chan is really back now. Still, don't let 08 die, keep posting, keep seeding, it's independent and resilient.

>>55eda31c-ec7b-4b98-bcbf-5d9c5753c1a2
That won't work. The problem is, that Cloudflare doesn't have enough competition. There needs to be a CDN service that is both better and cheaper than cf.

>>488c6f79-dc30-4323-8b03-f1d16f1122db
>Can internet users provide such a service for free....and perhaps make Cloudflare's business model untenable?
That would be hard to do too as you need quite a bit of infrastructure to provide a service like cf. Namely an autonomous system with lots of bandwith, your own DNS, your own CA for SSL certificates and so on. Cloudflare provide a huge packages of services, the DDOS protection is just the icing on the cake they can easily advertise. You would need lots of money. There are other companies that provide similar service though, they aren't as big and well known though.

>>cba9429d-2399-4b68-9df2-4b332ffdd50d
>You understand, I was hoping for a distributed solution which could be deployed on a very small scale? Only this protection would be consist of many nodes.
That could maybe be something like zeronet, but more user friendly. But the idea of mirroring normal websites on distributed networks in general has potential from the anti-censorship point of view. This way stuff couldn't get lost anymore.

>>b035e8d8-8751-45db-ad08-2a793b90c8eb
Yeah Germany may have freedom of speech high up in its constitution but never really gave a fuck about it. In Germany you can very well go to jail for saying the wrong things. Now they make new laws to extend that to the internet that traditionally is harder to control.

>>52161f90-9d78-4f67-9544-cb72de48497a
It's available now and there doesn't seem to be too much of the actual content that was redacted. But it's all German.
https://fragdenstaat.de/anfrage/untersuchungen-zum-verschlusselungsprogramm-truecrypt/#nachricht-442037

>>fc367d0a-5f79-4f65-b8f8-9045173a5d35
>The update reverts the "no_proxy_for" settings and removes the old option to change them.
Really? I don't remember it doing that. But I think it changed something else that pissed me off. I get that they want to make torbrowser as secure as possible but simply overriding user configuartion on an update is never okay.

>>de846ff3-10ae-4cca-bcfa-1281e2bf1cda
Hm, I haven't heard about this anywhere else. It's not very specific either - how would that trojan gain access to the system in the first place? How does it store up to 3GB of logs without being detected? How would it obfuscate the packet bursts?
Interesting topic to look into, maybe there really are security flaws like this. Not too sure about this source though.

>>e09b0d28-49ff-49f2-b69b-b2d57f40a3b1
>Since Zeronet uses the Tor Browser's proxy - it is affected.
You mean on Linux, where everything runs through a centralized tor daemon, right?

>>b1b39dda-5431-4396-9ab9-db66baf62438
>I've seen no evidence there is a Tor daemon in this system. If I start Zeronet without the Tor browser already open - it just sits there.
I noticed that too. But then the Windows version ships with a tor.exe and seems to run it independently from the tor browser.

>>d8f810c0-eba2-4136-9226-64f2348fb451
Good to see that he can't get away with anything forever.

>>9ca9883f-2422-4686-be37-71a4ff256fe8
That's what you get for entrusting Google with your data storage. It's not like there are no alternatives. People could just buy a decent hard drive and use torrent, but I guess many will never learn, stick to mainstream cloud services and then weep when they do what they always do.

>>3febc2ed-c7bf-4872-bea8-b0b63eb6f7e9
Usually tor would be a systemd service and you'd control it with systemctl start/stop/restart tor. The config should be located at /etc/tor/torrc, I think you need to add a line or two for zeronet.
I haven't really played any of the 3d metroid games, are they good?

>>a65f9f27-cd34-4aa0-9d4b-d91f88afc55e
>>1548a6de-fe77-4e84-8d8a-ad46f41b64b8
Even if it was, an alternative could always be implemented. Hope it gets fixed soon though as interest in 08 seems to be growing a little.
Has it been fixed yet?

>>66ba081f-bce8-4ad6-89d1-8e7368fd41be
Sure, you need to wait until the falling-apart is complete before you can build a new society on top of these ashes. Nothing to do right now but to get popcorn and watch. It's quite funny watching all the people in urban areas go insane and turn onto each other.

>>8e7d91fd-7942-4a67-9360-c56eccee10c7
>ZeroID has been fixed by no fish. Haven't seen any problems there lately.
Great. Now all we need are threads that have replies and aren't the OP posting just an archive link.
